pullRequest.body:
This PR contains:
1. A proof that localization commutes with ranges.
2. Some missing lemmas about localized submodules.
3. A proof that injective, surjective,  bijective (of linear maps) are local properties.

These theorems will be used to prove that flat is a local property in a later PR.

Co-authored-by: Yongle Hu <mbkybky@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Yi Song <sif4delta0@mail.ustc.edu.cn>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I'm currently reorganizing/generalizing the file LocalProperties/Submodule at #19118. By introducing [`Submodule.localized₀`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19118/files#diff-b82a403c68ad063035d33f11de71f74ed1b98bbbe201177ceb9218b3679d3b9aR41) which is a submodule over the base ring rather than the localization, I'm able to get rid of `Rₚ` in this file completely. I also generalized the results to CommSemirings, and reordered the lemmas to make the development more natural and golf the proofs. Should I incorporate the new lemmas in this PR into my PR, or should this PR adapt to my changes (maybe after mine is merged)?
I'm not sure which of the setups is better. Can we discuss this in [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2319080.20Theorems.20about.20LocalizedModule)?
Looks great! In my branch I've moved a lemma and fixed namespace/capitalization issues: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/flat_local...flat_local_demo?expand=1

@su00000 Could you please incorporate those final changes that @alreadydone made in a branch? After that, I think this looks ready for merging!

Thanks for all your efforts!
Last comments; I personally wrote too much code for this PR so I'll wait for another reviewer's approval.
Thanks for doing this!
Last comments; I personally wrote too much code for this PR so I'll wait for another reviewer's approval.

```suggestion
open Submodule IsLocalizedModule

/-- Localization commutes with ranges. -/
lemma LinearMap.localized'_range_eq_range_localizedMap (g : M →ₗ[R] P) :
```

```suggestion
    exact ⟨(mk' f m a), by simp [hm, ha]⟩
```

```suggestion
In this file, we show that injectivity, surjectivity, bijectivity and exactness of linear maps are local properties. More precisely, we show that these can be checked at maximal ideals and on finite standard covers.
```
Also, I think that the file should be called `Mathlib/RingTheory/LocalProperties/Exactness.lean` instead.

Could you please formulate all these lemmas for an arbitrary family of module satisfying the correct `IsLocalizedModule` predicate? You can have a look at `LocalProperties.Submodule` for a possible setup. I think it should not cause significantly more work, since all the results you use are already formulated in the general setup.

```suggestion
/-- Another version, using `LocalizedModule` instead of `IsLocalizedModule`. -/
```
and below

nothing breaks :)
```suggestion
  (s : Set R) (spn : Ideal.span (s : Set R) = ⊤)
```

```suggestion
  (s : Set R) (spn : span (s : Set R) = ⊤) (f : M →ₗ[R] M')
```
I've started adapting new materials in this PR to my #19118 [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19126/commits/8e0bcab8308b5cbe0d39123c5e778a675ed6fb7e).

#19126 now contains `span` lemmas too, but only the `IsLocalizedModule` version. I've been able to golf the two largest proofs. Please feel free to copy from or merge #19126 and add the `LocalizedModule` variants, preferably after #19126 is merged into master.

I'm worried about the inconsistency of names: for `maximal` lemmas you add a `'` for the LocalizedModule version, but for the `span` lemmas you add a `'` for the IsLocalizedModule version. I think the latter convention is better, because the LocalizedModule versions are easier to apply and should be considered the default, so their names shouldn't have a `'`.
Oh now seeing this. I would argue the other way round or even propose, as above, `of_isLocalized` vs `of_localized`. This is clear and avoids a `'`.

#19118 is now merged, and I'm following this `localized` vs `isLocalized` convention [in #19126](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19126/commits/b9bce1857ba2ceb3d94215cde96679db7f772cc0), but I only applied it to new `span` lemmas but not yet the existing `maximal` lemmas, and I only introduced the `isLocalized` version. If @su00000 and @erdOne agree, let's make the `maximal` lemmas follow the new convention too, and deprecate the old names.
Sorry for my late answer, and thanks for doing these! I'll merge #19126 to #19080. I agree.
I've updated #19126 to implement my last suggestions; again, please feel free to merge. I think this is ready to go!

Once #19118 is merged, this (and other lemmas below) can be generalized to AddCommMonoid/CommSemiring. `ker_eq_bot` doesn't work in that setting but you can directly use [Module.eq_of_localization_maximal](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/LocalProperties/Submodule.html#Module.eq_of_localization_maximal).

I think it is easier if you do it the other way round, i.e. first prove the general version, then just plugin in `LocalizedModule` etc. into the general version to obtain the specialized one. Also I think the general version deserves the unprimed name, or even `injective_of_isLocalized` and `injective_of_localized`.
(same applies below)

```suggestion
theorem injective_of_localized_span
```
by our new convention. (and everywhere below)

Wht not
```suggestion
variable {R M N L : Type*} [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M]
  [AddCommMonoid N] [Module R N] [AddCommMonoid L] [Module R L] (f : M →ₗ[R] N) (g : N →ₗ[R] L)
```
? Then we can remove those variables from `exact_of_localized_maximal`. The same applies to `exact_of_localization_span `.

Looks like this works everywhere `mkLinearMap` is called:
```suggestion
    _ (fun _ _ ↦ mkLinearMap _ _)
```
but it's up to you whether to replace them.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/LocalProperties): Add theorems about LocalizedModule

source.title: feat(RingTheory/LocalProperties): flatness is a local property

nodes.body: Thanks for doing this!

I'm currently reorganizing/generalizing the file LocalProperties/Submodule at #19118. By introducing [`Submodule.localized₀`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19118/files#diff-b82a403c68ad063035d33f11de71f74ed1b98bbbe201177ceb9218b3679d3b9aR41) which is a submodule over the base ring rather than the localization, I'm able to get rid of `Rₚ` in this file completely. I also generalized the results to CommSemirings, and reordered the lemmas to make the development more natural and golf the proofs. Should I incorporate the new lemmas in this PR into my PR, or should this PR adapt to my changes (maybe after mine is merged)?
I'm not sure which of the setups is better. Can we discuss this in [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2319080.20Theorems.20about.20LocalizedModule)?

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(RingTheory): improve and generalize submodule localization API
